system.description: People of the sea, they are never very comfortable far from a large body of water. Corsairs are wanderers and like to be on the move. Corsairs tend to be humble in that they understand that nature is greater than they are and respect it for that. If you are an Corsair, crave water and sailing, go with the flow, keep on the move, and keep things ship shape.

results.hit: Target takes a @L[Damage:Hack]{body hack}.
results.critHit: If you want, target takes @L[Core:Damage]{standard damage} as well.

overview.base: When you @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack} with @L[Ability:Wind Shuriken]{Wind Shuriken}, you may target an additional creature or the same creature twice. Any costs you pay must be paid twice and be the same for both @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attacks} These incur @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack penalties} as though they were two separate @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attacks}.

You become @L[Keyword:Resistance]{resistant} to effects that would make you @L[Condition:Snared]{snared}, effects that would make you @L[Condition:Immobile]{immobile}, and to @L[Damage:Hack]{hack damage} dealt by other creatures.
Note: This does not clear any existing effects.
You gain @L[Ability:Ship Lore]{Ship Lore} and @L[Ability:Improvised Ship Repairs]{Improvised Ship Repairs}.
You no longer have to stay on the surface of water while @L[Ability:Swimming]{Swimming}.
You have @L[Keyword:Limited]{Limited} @L[Ability:Instant Awaken]{Instant Awaken} for allies aboard the ship you are captaining.

system.limitation: Target must be an ally aboard the ship you are captaining.

overview.base:
You recognize details about ships by sight. For a given target ship, you know the following.
  • Where it was built.
  • How damaged it is.
  • What it was built for (warship, cargo ship, and so on).
  • How old it is (roughly).
  • How fast it can go (roughly).
  • Any noteworthy features.

You may also make a @L[Tradecraft:Historian]{historian} @L[Core:Tradecrafts]{check} to learn more about the ship, its crew, its captain, or other features the @L[Core:GM]{GM} allows.

During a @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest}, you may scavenge materials and repair 1 part of a ship. These repairs exist for 8 hours before they are no longer functional. The types of repairs you can make are as follows.
  • A mast.
  • A sail.
  • A steering wheel.
  • A rudder.
  • A hole in the hull.
  • A cannon.
  • A crow's nest.
  • A figurehead.
  • A plank.
  • A ladder.
  • An anchor.
With @L[Core:GM]{GM} permission, you may be able to repair other parts of a ship as well.
overview.proficient: You can instead make up to @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} repairs.
overview.fluent: You can instead make up to @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} repairs.
